sentence.text: She decided that she would drop in and see how he was .
I never worried about her this last year , you know , because I knew you dropped in and kept an eye on her .
People dropped in and more toast was eaten .
He awaited a reply eagerly and was going to drop in to see her on his next leave .
` Charles just dropped in to wish me luck , " Lesley-Jane supplied hastily .
But the shy and introspective Allen habitually returned to his bachelor pad -- after dropping in to kiss the children goodnight .
` You never drop in on her ? "
She said she could n't stay , that she had just dropped in for a minute .
If you 've only seen a De Lorean car in the Back to the Future films then drop in at the old plant in Dunmurry on Saturday afternoon ( 3.30 ) where the dream machine was produced .
It would probably be better to drop in at The Times ' party , see who he could find to have dinner with and take pot luck in a town not noted for its restaurants .
Judi Goodwin drops in for a mince pie and soaks up the atmosphere of this warm , family home .
` You normally drop in on people this late ? "
This morning I dropped in on the two ladies of the Inder Lal family -- his wife , Ritu , and his mother .
Her mother might even drop in .
She and my wife , Celia , got on fairly well and Inez would sometimes drop in unexpectedly and stay rather long -- but never overnight . "
It was not a question requiring an answer -- Weasel was a good friend from art school days and often dropped in unannounced .
It 's different here , Léonie tried to explain : in our kitchen in London no one ever drops in for a chat .
At first I thought it was a party but afterwards realised that they had just dropped in .
It started when some people dropped in unexpectedly for a drink one evening and simply would not go .
I 'll drop in again when I 'm passing , " shouted the lady , as she retreated into the uproar .
` She just missed one , so she dropped in at our local for some fags , and stayed to have a drink . "
There 's a grudge against Tom because he drops in on everyone .
You can drop in on Keith while I go round and see people .
I could drop in at your place about five or six .
In the end I dropped in on Oliver Craddock , just out of curiosity , and he saw everything without my telling him a word . "
He asked her to drop in on his Mum and Dad and say hello , and to make sure that his father was n't drinking too much .
PREMIER John Major dropped in for a chat with British troops in the Bosnian front line yesterday .
